node.title: William Tyrrell strategy 'lacking in early days' but valuable lessons helped find Cleo Smith, expert says
node.description: A leading criminologist says some of the reasons William Tyrrell hasn't been found in seven years helped police in Western Australia locate missing girl Cleo Smith after 18 days.
node.content:
["When Cleo Smith disappeared from a remote campsite in Western Australia, it took police less than three weeks to find her \u2014\u00a0but there's been no sign of William Tyrrell since the toddler vanished\u00a0seven years ago.", "Leading criminologist Xanthe Mallett said investigators around the world have learned valuable lessons from one of Australia's most baffling cases, which began in the sleepy town of Kendall on the NSW Mid-North Coast.", "William Tyrrell was playing \"tigers\" with his older sister in the garden of his foster-grandmother's home when his foster-mother went inside to make a cup of tea on September 12, 2014.", "When she returned, the three-year-old vanished without a trace \u2014\u00a0but officers didn't tape off the Benaroon Drive property straight away.", "", "
Police sift debris from the front garden of William Tyrrell\u2019s foster-grandmother\u2019s house.(AAP: Mick Tsikas)
", "\"Perhaps some of the reasons William wasn't found assisted in the Cleo Smith case \u2014\u00a0and that can only be a positive thing because every investigation is different,\" Dr Mallett said.", "Panic overcame the town of Carnarvon when\u00a0four-year-old Cleo went missing from her parent's tent in the Blowholes campsite, about a 10 hour drive from Perth.", "\"WA threw everything at the investigation straight away \u2014\u00a0they established a large task force of about 140 officers and they shut down the site very quickly, as well as announcing a million dollar reward.\"", "It took the NSW government two years before they announced a $1 million reward for information that could reveal what happened to William.", "It was a landmark moment and the first time that sum of money had been thrown at a case, but so far, it has failed to answer one question,\u00a0what happened to the boy in the Spider-Man suit?", "Dr Mallett said the case was not immediately treated as a child abduction case.", "\"Police were initially looking for a child that had wandered off, which meant that the area was not forensically searched \u2014\u00a0people were allowed to leave the area, cars were leaving the area,\" she said.", "\"A lot of the really early steps that would have helped locate a child that had been abducted for example were not taken \u2014\u00a0I think it was just the speed at which police responded, the seriousness at which it was treated.", "\"I think that strategy was lacking in the Tyrrell matter in the early days.\"", "", "
Police have used ground penetrating radar during the search for William Tyrrell's remains this week.(ABC News: Kamin Gock)
", "A renewed search around the foster-grandmother's home has failed to reveal anything new about what happened to William Tyrrell.", "It's based on a new theory that the boy could have potentially fallen from the balcony into a garden bed.", "So far, there is no evidence that has been made public to suggest that is the case.", "A new person of interest emerged as the foster- grandmother's grey car was seized from its new owner at a home in Gymea, in Sydney's south.", "As the new investigation transpired, NSW Police Commissioner Mick Fuller blasted the initial one, saying too much time was \"wasted\" on \"some persons of interest\".", "Former lead detective Gary Jubelin was stood down as head of Strike Force Rosann after illegally recording four conversations he had with a neighbour in 2017 and 2018.", "But he did not oversee the investigation until five months after William disappeared in 2014.", "\"A new team on board \u2026 inherited what was a bit of a mess and have cleaned up that investigation,\" Commissioner Fuller said.", "", "
Dr Mallett said\u00a0the Tyrrell case was not immediately treated as child abduction.(ABC Capricornia: Inga St\u00fcnzner)
", "Dr Mallett has criticised Commissioner Fuller's comments, saying it is certainly not the type of commentary expected from a senior police officer.", "\"It was certainly unusual to hear that level of criticism levelled at an ongoing investigation \u2014\u00a0certainly in its early stages \u2014\u00a0and I am not sure if it is the helpful commentary at this stage,\" she said.", "\"I think the focus should remain firmly on what's happened to William, and who is responsible \u2013 I think anything outside of that can be a distraction.\""]
